idioms.example: He told a joke to break the ice at the meeting.
We should hit the road early to avoid traffic.
The exam was a piece of cake.

idioms.idiom: cost an arm and a leg
idioms.example: That new car costs an arm and a leg.
I'm feeling a bit under the weather today.
I had to bite the bullet and tell him the truth.

idioms.idiom: let the cat out of the bag
idioms.example: Who let the cat out of the bag about the surprise party?

idioms.idiom: kill two birds with one stone
idioms.example: By working from the cafe, I can kill two birds with one stone.
Come on, spill the beans! What happened?
He got cold feet before the job interview.
We need to think outside the box to solve this problem.
The project failed, so we're back to square one.
Let's get the ball rolling on this project.
Let's make sure we're on the same page before the meeting.
I'll touch base with you next week about the project.
She was over the moon when she got the promotion.
He's been on cloud nine since he met her.
She's been down in the dumps since she failed the exam.
Don't get bent out of shape over such a small thing.
I only eat fast food once in a blue moon.
He arrived in the nick of time for the meeting.
The hospital operates around the clock.
We don't want to break the bank on this vacation.
It's hard to make ends meet with this salary.
You should put money aside for emergencies.
Stop beating around the bush and tell me what happened.
Let me get straight to the point.
Don't be afraid to speak your mind in the meeting.
We hit it off from the moment we met.
We don't always see eye to eye on everything.
I get along with most of my coworkers.
She always goes the extra mile for her clients.
I've been burning the midnight oil to finish this project.
Keep trying! Practice makes perfect.
I'm still on the fence about taking the job offer.
It's a big decision. Why don't you sleep on it?
You need to make up your mind soon.

examples: Can you pick up my dry cleaning?
I'll pick you up at 7.
She picked up Spanish very quickly.
Turn on the lights, please.
Don't forget to turn off the TV.
Put on your jacket, it's cold outside.
She put on some makeup before leaving.
Take off your shoes at the door.
The plane took off on time.
I'm looking for my keys.
Are you looking for something specific?
Can you look after my dog this weekend?
She looks after her elderly parents.
Don't give up! You can do it.
He gave up smoking last year.
Can you come up with a better idea?
She came up with a brilliant solution.
I ran into an old friend yesterday.
You might run into some problems.
I can't figure out this math problem.
We need to figure out what went wrong.
I work out three times a week.
Everything will work out in the end.
Don't bring up that topic.
She was brought up in a small town.
Don't put off your homework.
The meeting was put off until next week.
It took time to get over the breakup.
I hope you get over your cold soon.
Carry on with your work.
Despite the difficulties, they carried on.
Could you help me with this?
Could you speak more slowly?
Could you tell me the way to the station?
Would you mind opening the window?
Would you mind waiting for a moment?
Would you mind if I sat here?
I'd like to make a reservation.
I'd like to order a coffee.
I'd like to check out, please.
I think it's a good idea.
I think we should wait.
I think you're right.
In my opinion, this is the best option.
In my opinion, we need more time.
I agree with you completely.
I agree with that idea.
I'm afraid I disagree with that point.
I'm afraid I can't agree with you there.
What I mean is, we need more research.
What I mean is, it's not that simple.
In other words, we need to start over.
In other words, he's not coming.
